intro: Sorengia stenodes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes species known for their distinctive leaf shapes and edible leaves. The plant typically features slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, three-lobed seeds. Sorengia stenodes is often found in moist, shady environments such as forest floors or stream banks.
